com.client

Class ResourceLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.client.ResourceLoader

  • public abstract class ResourceLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to encapsulate loading an asset. If the operation fails, informs the user that there was a problem, and then gracefully exits, instead of throwing a stack trace or anything nasty like that. Also defines some nice directory variables.
    Author:
    Ian

      • showError

        public static void showError(java.lang.String msg)
        Shows an "Asset Loading Error" with the given message, and then exits when the user clicks OK.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to show to the user.

      • loadImageResource

        public static final DrawableResource loadImageResource(java.lang.String path)
        Attempts to load an image. If this cannot be done, shows an error and exits. Only loads resources as necessary. Uses a cached copy if possible.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the resource.
        Returns:
        the resource.

      • loadImageResource

        public static final DrawableResource loadImageResource(java.lang.String path,
                                 float scalar)
        Attempts to load an image. If this cannot be done, shows an error and exits. Only loads resources as necessary. Uses a cached copy if possible.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the resource.
        scalar - the amount to resize.
        Returns:
        the resource.

      • loadFont

        public static final java.awt.Font loadFont(java.lang.String name,
                     int size)
        Loads a font. Caches the fonts that it loads. If you ask for an already loaded font at a given size, it will return the cached copy. If you want a different size of an already loaded texture, a new subtype will be generated from the cached superfont.
        Parameters:
        name - the font's name.
        size - the size to load.
        Returns:
        the font.
